string.text: There was a strange artifact on the dredger... here, take it.

Interesting... half artifact... Jackpot! I believe that a job well done is a job well paid. You have good skills, I can put them to good use... see, I have a few artifact orders... you're more than capable of completing any one of them.
Got any work for me?
Yeah... some stalkers reported a strange glow on the dredger at night... it's weird, even for the Zone. Go there and check it out.
Got it.
Be careful and remember! The place is heavily irradiated, so take antirads with you. Don't be careless.
Not now.
No more jobs are available, check back tomorrow.
Take the helm artifact.

We have a winner! I believe that a job well done, is a job well paid. You have good skills, I can put them to good use... see, I have a few artifact orders... you're more than capable of completing any one of them.
I found a strange artifact on the dredger... want to take a look?
Interesting. Half artifact... Sell it to me. I think... 3000 is a good price.
I saw the artifact on the barge you sent me to.

Sorry, but that will not do. I gave you a simple job - bring me the artifact and then get paid. You know the Zone rules - look at both sides, pick and choose your friends and keep your mouth shut. Though if you need a reliable job... just holler. I have some artifact orders and you seem a capable sort.
What artifacts do you need?
I'll get a Gravi.
Excellent! That's what I understand - speed ... Keep your profit.
I'll get the Eye.
I'll get a Baloon.
I'll get a Dummy.
I'll get a Goldfish.
I'll get a Flame.
I'll get a Firefly.
I'll get a Snowflake.
I can sell you a Gravi.
There is something strange happening. Guys take an order and disappear... I have a bad feeling about this, I better pack up for now.
I can sell you the Eye.
I can sell you a Baloon.
I can sell you a Dummy.
I can sell you a Goldfish.
I can sell you a Flame.
I can sell you a Firefly.
I can sell you a Snowflake.
I see.
Both groups working for me have disappeared... I decided to stop taking orders for now.
I have completed the order.
Excellent! Keep the change.
Here. Not as much, but a lot nonetheless.
Tell me about things on the order.
Who can I hire to protect the scientists?

My boys - Spartacus and his team. They're experienced guys, before the Zone happened they worked security gigs as - can you believe it? - riot police. They know which end of the gun spits bullets, so if they're currently available - you can get the scientists some real safety.
I could suggest you someone a while ago... but now... Spartacus is gone, and so is his team.
Who can we hire to conduct measurements for the scientists?

Gaunt and his guys, you know them? When off hunting season, they work with... errr... enthusiasm, especially if the job doesn't include shooting. They say their trigger fingers are numb... some even missing.
I have no idea. I haven't heard from Gaunt for a long time... they'd be a good choice.
Tell me about life here.
That's a broad subject. Just ask your questions and I'll answer them.
What can stalkers do around here?

My friend, just look around. Outside Skadovsk - they explore, look for artifacts... get shot by angry people... while inside Skadovsk, they drink, talk, rest before their next excursion... When the blowout comes, everyone sits here silently, remembering the fate of those who failed to reach shelter in time. It's a nice set-up we have here.
What led stalkers to the centre of the Zone?

Funny question... some wanted to find legendary Klondike artifacts, others were motivated by rumours of the mythical Oasis... and then there were those seeking the Wish Granter. Oh, and don't forget the most basic of reasons - simple curiosity... everyone had a reason to go. I think even you would find one.
How did you get here?

Came through the woods when the Brain Scorcher was deactivated...but that's not what you want, right? My primary business are artifacts. Those little chunks of gold have plenty of... fans outside the Zone, interested in this rare commodity. I decided to establish a stalker camp, providing people with what they need. And what does a stalker need, when he returns to the Skadovsk? A drink and a conversation, and we have more than enough of it here, on the Skadovsk.
What do you think about the bandits?

How to put it... in principle, Skadovsk is for everyone. If they behave properly, of course. In the end, complete bastards are uncommon, most of the bandits are former stalkers... and maybe the crew of the Skadovsk will make one reconsider his life and abandon shady business before he gets shot.
Ah, okay. Forget it.
Anything you say.
Tell me, did you see any soldiers around here?

Think for a minute. How long do you think a soldier would last here? They wouldn't come within a mile of this place... we remember all too well how we had to crawl through mud, trying to avoid their roadblocks and guns.
Tell me about the Compass.

There are many myths surrounding this artifact... they say that, if you know how to use it, the Compass will allow you to pass through any anomalies. I think you can understand just how much my clients would like to get one. Recently, I learned that Noah, a stalker who lives south of here, might know something about it.
Well, I'll go to Noah.
I'll think about it.
A legendary artifact, as I told you already. See Noah, a stalker who lives south of here, he might know something about it.
I found a strange artifact near . Interested?
Let me take a look... a peculiar thing, yes, but I don't think I'll find a buyer for it. You're better off taking it to the scientists, same place as ... they might be interested in it.
Owl said that you did not fulfil your end of the bargain.

We had an agreement, I get the detectors and then give him a cut from the profits earned thanks to them, as payment. I paid for two detectors already. The deal was simple, without any other agreements... if you help me work it out, then you can take the third detector for free.
So, what should I tell Owl?
I suppose.

It'd be best if you didn't talk to him at all. I need work done - and I can offer you a two or three hours handicap to find artifacts, it should be enough to let you find them before others do. And, if you're interested, I have a special order waiting. You see, I need an artifact called the Compass.
Sultan managed to grab the Compass.
This bastard was just itching to do it... well, it's not important, go to Noah again. According to rumours, the artifact you gave Sultan might be... worthless.
I found the Compass, here, take it.

My friend, you just saved me! See, the trust of one my influential clients was at stake. Word had it, that Sultan wanted to snatch him right from under my nose... well, all he snatched is a load of failure. Here, take this reward as thanks.
I don't think I want to look for the Compass.
Pity. But, what can you do ...
Sultan sends his greetings. By the way, all your supply lines are blocked.

...now I see who's behind all this. I'm not going to part with Skadovsk, so it seems I have no choice but to work for you and Sultan. Okay. He'll get a percentage from all transactions... I'll hand over the cash once a day. It will be waiting for you.
Give me my cut.
Here.
Come later, I'm not due yet.
What do you think, could Nimble be selling stolen goods?

No, it's unlikely ... As far as I know him, he prefers to steer clear of shady business, after all, a businessman values his reputation. Besides, I haven't heard anyone say a single bad word about him.
I am looking for Snag. Do you know where I can find him?
Last time I saw him was when he left the bar. If the guys heard him right, he was going to the port cranes, look for him there.
A group of stalkers if going to go plunder. Apart from that, all's the same.
Gee. Bandits nowadays, like fleas on a dog ... So, they're looking for a fight?
I was offered a job, a night attack on the camp at Shevchenko.
Bastards... I'll warn the guys and the attackers will get a nice, friendly welcome...
Alright.
Now get back to this ass, I'll tell the guys.
Good idea.
I got an artifact from the Oasis. Interested?

The Heart of the Oasis...? No... not really... the rumours say that thing can affect the owner's mind. Call me superstitious, but I'd prefer to stay away from it... you should pass it along to the scientists.
A rookie, eh? Heh, you'll find the Zone... a hard teacher. I'm Beard, the bartender here. If you have any questions, come straight to me.
Tell me....
Want to make a living looking for artifacts?
How is my order? Don't forget, a cheetah earns more than a sloth.
You're late, I already have the artifact... but if you have another one, like the one ordered, I'm willing to buy it... at a reduced price.

There's a job available. If the rumours are true, the bandits are going to purchase a shipment of guns for themselves. We want to track them down and, if possible, crash the party. Help will be appreciated.
Well?
What are the mercs doing at the treatment plant?
Better stay away from there, its none of your business.
Do you work for the scientists?
Yeah, glad you asked. Smarts alone won't stop a bullet.
I'm putting together a squad for a hike in Pripyat. You in?
No, I have to take care of the scientists... You can try talking Sokolov into it, he wanted to see Pripyat.
No, I have to take care of the scientists... This is a permanent security gig.
Ekhm... No, I should stay here.
Would you like to work for the scientists?
Interesting ... What's the job?
Guard and defend their bunker.
Of course we'd like to, thanks for the offer.
You'll be paid in artifacts.
Nah, this work is not for us, it's for stalkers.
Listen stalker, we're getting real anxious, do you have the fodder?
I could bring some food.
Ha! Well, bring it. Canned food, sausages, bread... six in total should be enough to give each one of us something to chew.
They say there might be a toolkit buried somewhere around here.
Who knows... don't show yourself around here too much, me and the rest of the guys are getting edgy without food.
Who knows... if you're serious about it, go dig through the trash pile nearby, maybe you'll find what you need.
I brought some food for your men.

I didn't expect you to actually do it... thank you, the guys will finally have something normal to eat... you wanted to dig through the trash? Feel free to do so, maybe you'll find what you need, just keep that iron holstered.
I didn't expect you to actually do it... thank you, the guys will finally have something normal to eat... you're welcome here, bro. Just keep that gun where it belongs - holstered.
Go away, this us our camp, nothing to scavenge here... me and my boys are getting edgy without normal food.
Now listen, we get itchy trigger fingers when we're hungry...
Stalker, is it something important? If not, let me get back to my work.
I'm ready to go hunting.
Well... time to go.
Come.
Now's not the time, come back at 3 AM.
Understood.
Us too... just remember - the chimera isn't exactly the hardest sleeper. Looks like it's time for another hunt.
Gaunt's dead... how could it happen? You're going to Yanov? Tutsan's there, maybe... maybe you could tell him that the chimera is dead...? I'll probably just go home...
See you.
What the... Gaunt died because of you. What do we do now?
See you.
Tell me about yourself.

I'm Gaunt, captain of the hunter group. When asked to, we blow away mutants. We can also take them alive, for scientists to do experiments or when someone wants an exotic four legged friend... as Tutsan said, every animal has its own bullet.
Tell me about mutants.

Well, I'm not the most experienced hunter of them all... But I can tell you about the more common animals: fleshes, boars, blind dogs and pseudodogs, Snorks, tuskany... I also know a thing or two about bloodsuckers.
Tell me about wild boars and fleshes.

Well, the flesh is pretty much the most innocuous of the mutants. It usually avoids stalkers, but will fight back if threatened. Now, boars are really dangerous beasts - three hundred kilograms of raw meat make it a hunter's nightmare. When fighting it, avoid its line of attack, use its inertia against itself. See, such a massive carcass can't turn around very fast, so dodge to the side and shoot.
Tell me about the blind dogs and pseudodogs.

Single dogs aren't dangerous, not unless they are in a pack. Attack only when they're hungry, but the catch is, they're perpetually hungry. If you're hunting a pack, try to take the higher ground, otherwise you'll be swamped, especially if old pseudodogs are in the pack. They are tenacious little bastards, much more dangerous and cunning. Now, if you spot a single pseudodog, yet almost immediately an entire pack attacks you, remember: the ones attacking you are phantoms. The real one will stay at a distance, biting only occasionally. Use your Kung Fu to figure out which is it and put it down. As soon as it dies, the phantoms will fade away.
Tell me about Snorks.

The sad remains of what was once human. One Snork is a small threat to an agile hunter. Just time his jumps and sidestep to avoid his leap. Now, things get a little more complicated when there are several of these bastards... then you just have to kill them off one by one, using all your speed and agility to dodge their leaps. The mutants know their strength lies in numbers and so, they rarely attack alone.
Tell me about tushkanah.

Horror hunters... underestimating them because of their size is the last mistake you'll make. They are insanely fast, aggressive and always deadly - when dozens of these rats start tearing you to pieces, that's when you stop underestimating them and the pain starts. Worse, when you realize they are difficult to actually hit. That's why I tell all stalkers to always carry a loaded shotgun...
Tell me about bloodsuckers.

Almost perfect hunters with excellent camouflage. When they cloak, they are practically invisible. When you go against a bloodsucker, startle it, it is a bit more visible in motion. Remember, a bloodsucker will always attempt to attack you in the back, trying to grab your neck with its tentacles, god-damn abomination. Now, if you are really lucky and stumble across a pack - always watch your back.
Okay, got it.
If you see Soroka... tell him...
This debt will not remain unsettled... I'll tear out all of his feathers.
What did Soroka screw up?

This stalker came up to me once, telling me that he can't collect his loot because of a controller. Now, we were just one person short of a full squad, as our tracker - Daniel - went off to track down the bloodsucker lair, so we worked out a deal. We would help him with his loot and he would come with us to the hunt, as the fourth guy. His job was simple - stand next to the lair entrance and let us know when the chimera rears its ugly head...
What happened next?

Then, that bastard Soroka ran, grabbing both his and our loot. And when the chimera suddenly appeared, it took us by surprise... damn, we had no time to react, who would have? I had to protect the group, that bastard be damned. I managed to bust up the chimera a bit, but she managed to mess Crab up severely before running away. A week of training down the drain ...

Listen, hunting is in your blood! Here, take this as a token of my appreciation and admiration. As Tutsan says, skill is your first weapon... by the way, do you plan to drop by Yanov? It'd be a good idea to tell Tutsan that the chimera is dead. I'm heading back to the Skadovsk, to wait until Crab gets better. You going with us?
Yes. Let's go.
No. I'll look around the place.

We managed to do it, take this as a token of my appreciation. Not everything went smoothly, but it's nothing. In the words of Tutsan, with experience, you won't need a trap... by the way, do you plan to drop by Yanov? It'd be a good idea to tell Tutsan that the chimera is dead. I'm heading back to the Skadovsk, to wait until Crab gets better. You going with us?

Garmat died ... Chimera dies, but at a high price. Are you going to Yanov? It is necessary to inform Tutsan that the chimera is dead. I'll stay at Skadovsk, wait until Crab gets better. Are you going?
I found Daniel. He's dead. Killed by the late Tremor.
Ffffff- why do the best die young...? Tremor, bitch... to kill Daniel... fuck this life!
Do you think Nimble sells stolen goods?

Stolen? Where did you get that idea? I've known him for a long time, and order guns from him all the time. His goods are excellent, and the price... look, this is the first time I hear of such claims. Perhaps competitors appeared and spread rumours to undermine him.
I'm putting together a squad for a hike in Pripyat. Want to go with me?

I have a contract with the scientists that I need to fulfil... And no, I wouldn't go, even if I could. Go talk to Sokolov. He's been boring us with his "it's necessary to go to Pripyat". Hey, go yourself, if you have the guts. Besides, he's a grunt.
I have a contract with the scientists that I need to fulfil... And no, I wouldn't go even if I could. Now excuse me.
No, I don't feel like it. Hunting I have here. You know how many mutants are out there, enough to give a good hunter a job for three hundred years.
Don't you want to work for the scientists?
What's the job?
Guarding their bunker.
No, thanks. I'm a hunter, my job - killing mutants. There's not a lot of mutants at the bunker, besides, my guys are here...
You'll be checking anomalies.
What? We can do that. So, the open season is officially closed! A break like this is a welcome change from this perpetual nervousness before the hunt...
No, not now. You understand, hunting is impossible with a bloodthirsty mutant roaming the Zone freely.
What I want now is to grab Soroka by the throat. Then I'll be relaxed, calm and ready to talk about this new job.
Nah... we have our own problems. On one hand - a chimera needs to be put down, on the other - I need to find Soroka... no time for a new job.
I found Soroka. He was at the Yanov station, calling himself Flint.
Is this son of a bitch alive? Well, not for long... Here, take this for the information. I can't wait to see this asshole again... Flint, you say...
Yes. Thank you.
Hey, did you see Soroka? Know who he is? ...no? Well, if you meet this asshole, feel free to put a slug in his head. And if you first tell me where he is, I'll owe you, big time.
We'll see.

Wait! We tracked down a chimera, the matter is urgent. Crab hasn't recuperated yet, Daniel's missing and it'd be foolish to go after it right now. We need a third hunter, you're the guy that found Soroka, don't you want to kill a chimera?

Wait! We tracked down a chimera, the matter is urgent. Crab hasn't recuperated yet, Daniel's... ah... it'd be foolish to go after it right now. We need a third hunter, you look like a guy who knows his stuff, don't you want to kill a chimera?
With pleasure.

Like Tutsan said, hunting shouldn't be a job left unfinished. Listen, a Chimera generally hunts at night, at around three AM it crawl into a den and falls asleep, on its last legs. At this time it has to be found and killed. Be ready, at three we're hitting it with full force. Until then, you can find us in the bar.
I see.
So, come back at three o'clock at night. At this time chimera should be just falling asleep, as the dawn breaks...
Cheers. How's life? You look pretty happy.
Ah, cool. Small world, I see.
Ready? Time to get that chimera.
Hey, aren't you edgy before a big hunt?
Tutsan asked me to help you in your hunt for the chimera.

And with good reason. Fact is, we finally tracked the chimera down, a pity that Crab's not back on his feet yet and Daniel's still gone. We'll go together, if Tutsan chose you, you must be a damn good hunter. Listen, a Chimera generally hunts at night, at around three AM it crawl into a den and falls asleep, on its last legs. At this time it has to be found and killed. Be ready, at three we're hitting it with full force. Until then, you can find us in the bar.
What, decided to make a fool out of me?
You are a fool, but fools learn.
Nothing. Small world, and the Zone's even smaller. See you later.
Go... Go away. On Skadovsk fists won't get you anywhere.
Well, well.
I was wrong, of course. But you did not play by the rules.
That can only happen in the Zone. Okay, cut the chatter.
I saw a true fool, who just let go an artifact.
Okay, do not cry... if anything, you'll remember this lesson. And to make it stay, grab a beer can and relax.
I will not give my share up.
Beer? I like beer.
So, you think you're a macho?! I'm not joking now! Give me the artifact, you fuck!!!
Bastard, take the artifact and run.
Fuck you ...

Friend! Listen, there are healing artifacts... I am in dire need, my friend suffers from a strange illness, drugs do not help! I couldn't find such an artifact in the Fruit Punch I jumped into, didn't you see one like it, mayhap?
If it's that important - take it.
Thank you, brother! We will not forget.
Later.
I have one. I find it useful.
What? My friend, just because... a man is going to die!
Everyone fends for himself in the Zone. Later.
No, haven't seen it. Later.
This artifact will bring you nothing but bad luck, believe me.
If you want it that much - take it.
Thank you, brother! We will not forget.
Later.
See you.
I have nothing to talk to you about.
Why do you live in this wreck?
This is the Ark! Remember... If you want to live, remember! When the wave comes, we'll be next. Here - you have a chance to survive... This is not going to let any mutant in.
You talked about some wave...

A mutant wave, which will crush and throw people out of the Zone! And those unfortunate enough to survive will be swept away in a huge, mad release! It will destroy all life in the Zone! Apart from those who will be ready.
Where did you get this dog?
This is Lassie. Nice bitch ... If not for her I would have been long eaten in my sleep. Damned mutants... Hate! You only start to close your eyes - and there they are, clawing, biting, grabbing...
I need an artifact called the Compass. Do you know where to find it?
When mutants jump out from all the cracks, this stuff will not help you... Oh, just take it and get out.
Thanks.
Do you know anything about the fallen helicopter?
Oh, here it is on the plateau, with Snorks running about. I go there once every two days to shoot a few... what are you looking at? Say something, stop staring!
How to get to the plateau?
You want to shoot snorks? Admirable... okay, I can show you.
Let's go.
Next time.
Stalker.
Hey... What do you want?
None of your business.
I'll take you there ... In the meantime, sit here. The release is coming... Understand? Emission !!!
I was near the lair.
You did? But they didn't calm down... there will be more mutants! And then they will attack! The wave will sweep all the unprepared from the face of the Zone!
Say, wouldn't you have another Compass, by any chance?
Do you think it will protect you from the blowout? Here, take it and go!
Thanks.
Who are you?
A stalker. We already met.
Something I don't remember ... Okay, what do you want?
Stalker. Just a stalker.
But, you came to the Ark ...
None of your business.
Oh, it's you ... What do you want?
Did you find another Compass artifact?
Tell me about anomalies.

Anomalies are very dangerous and in drastically different ways. They might be extremely hot, or full of poisonous gases or maybe it's just the radiation that sky rockets. Oh, and let's not forget destructive psionic fields! Everything depends on the anomalies themselves. There are a few main types: the Burner, Fruit Punch, Electro, gravitational... mobile ones also exist, but that's a different topic.
Tell me about the Burner.

If you see the air in front of you flicker, just like it does over asphalt on a hot summer day - that's a Burner. When something falls into it, it shoots out a very hot jet of flame... At first, they were theorized to be jets of natural gas, but this theory seems to have fallen out of use in the recent years.
Tell me about the Fruit Punch.

In this anomaly strange chemical processes take place continuously. The result is an acid, eating away skin and armour, and poisonous gasses, corroding lungs with equal efficiency. Fortunately, it's pretty easy to see in the open... not so much when it's in a dark tunnel.
Tell me about Electro.

Very interesting anomaly, which accumulates hefty charges of static electricity. Stalkers sometimes use the fact that metal objects discharge the anomaly to their advantage - they throw a bolt in and sprint through while a new charge builds up. I prefer to avoid them - the charge seems to build up far too quickly.
Tell me about gravitational anomalies.

Usually, they're inactive, but can be spotted, as they distort objects lying behind them. If you see it, better go around. All three known varieties trigger as soon as anything enters their range. The Springboard violently pushes everything away, sometimes throwing it long distances. The Vortex, on the other hand, draws stuff surrounding it in, compresses with horrible force and then ejects just as violently as the Springboard. The Carousel is particularly unpleasant - it lifts the victim in the air and spins him until he literally breaks.
Tell me about moving anomalies.

Personally, I only saw the Comet and the Tesla. The first is a fire ball, about a meter in diameter, but the heat emanating from it can be felt a good distance away, I assure you. Second can be described as a fireball too, only of an electrical nature... both anomalies are moving actively, but they seem to stick a single route. A patient stalker can easily pass through. Just remember - stay cautious.
Okay, got it.
Tell me about yourself.

I'm not called Pilot just for show. Routes I cover are always safe. I don't have a talent for finding artifacts or fighting bandits. Everyone must use their skill and enable others to use theirs... for a price, of course...
Tell me about the blowouts.
I have maps of the terrain between the Creek and Jupiter. Want to see?

Let me see... good scale. In my business it's a death sentence, if you miss details... Hmmm... Aha! Judging by the map, there's a safe, straight route between the Skadovsk and Yanov. I'll copy the route to my PDA, if you don't mind... Now, I can give you a good discount.
Perhaps you need a guide? I can show you the way through anomalies and won't let you die from blowout. Pilot, ready to fly.
Need help or a guide?
Glad to see you. Need help from the old Pilot?
On the road again?
My compliments. Restless again? I'm at your service.
Hello. If you need a guide, I can help... after the blowout ends. Until then, we can have a chat about anomalies, to keep boredom at bay.
I'm afraid I'm useless as a guide for the time being. The blowout is a rather significant obstacle.
How much will it cost to get to Yanov?
Unfortunately, it's a long way - 3000.
I agree, let's go.
I do not have enough cash.
I'm not going.
With your map - only 1000.
I agree, let's go.
I do not have enough cash.
I'm not going.
It's a long way - 3000. I will be at your disposal after the emission ends.
With your maps - only 1000. Just need to wait out the blowout...
Can you get me to Pripyat?
No. Everyone has his work... Look, there's Garik. I think he will be able to help you.
Personally - no. But for 6000 I will take you to Yanov and talk to Garik, he'll get you on your way to Pripyat. What do you think?
I agree, let's go.
I do not have enough cash.
I'm not going.
Personally - no. But just for 4000, I will take you to Yanov and talk to Garik, he'll get you on your way to Pripyat. What do you think?
I agree, let's go.
I do not have enough money.
I'm not going.
No. Everyone has his work... Look, there's Garik. I think he will be able to help you after the blowout.
Personally - no. But for 6000 I will take you to Yanov and talk to Garik, he'll get you on your way to Pripyat. What do you think? We can do it after the blowout.
Personally - no. But just for 4000, I will take you to Yanov and talk to Garik, he'll get you on your way to Pripyat. What do you think... Naturally, after the blowout.
Can you get me to Pripyat?

To Pripyat? No. My route is in sufficient demand, so I don't have to look for new ones... But I have a good friend who worked in the Jupiter factory. He told me that there are tunnels under the plant, leading to Pripyat. He didn't know the details, but he mentioned the factory administration building as a good place to start the search.
No. If you want to get there - try to find tunnels under Jupiter.
How much will it cost to get to Skadovsk?
Since I haven't found a detour - 3000.
I agree, let's go.
I do not have enough cash.
I'm not going.
New route - only 1000.
I agree, let's go.
I do not have enough cash.
I'm not going.
Since I haven't found a detour - 3000. I will be at your service at the end of the blowout.
New route - just 1000. Just need to wait out the emission...
Where can you go?
The Yanov station, not far from the Jupiter plant. And from there - back to Skadovsk... I prefer to know a few routes perfectly, than a hundred only so-so.
I interrupted the bandits' weapons deal.
Thank you for your help. I just remembered, how we did a similar thing in the 90's with an RPG, ah, memories... Here, take this. Cash is always of use.
I am looking for Glouchar. We were supposed to meet here.
Glouchar left you a note, said he was going to the port cranes... He learned something new about the missing stalkers.
Glouchar's dead. He, like all the other stalkers, was killed by Tremor... who is dead too.
Tremor? Hm... We had a snake in our home... anyone could have gone missing... even Glouch... thanks, friend, you saved the entire camp. Here, take it.
Tremor? Forgive me, my friend, but I cannot believe you. If you had evidence of his involvement, maybe then ... Ah, Glouchar, Glouchar ...
Here's Tremor's PDA. In it all the evidence you need.
Tremor? Hm... We had a snake in our home... anyone could have gone missing... even Glouch... thanks, friend, you saved the entire camp. Here, take it.
I will help you deal with the bandits.
Excellent. Go to the forest authority, our guys are already there. They can tell you more.
What do you know about Nimble? Could he be selling stolen weapons?
I know him well. It's not likely that he does it... anyone who sells stolen goods doesn't take advance orders.
I knew that very soon, if not you, then someone else would get to me ...
Tremor? Care to explain what's going on?
I have nothing to hide. To stay silent makes no sense ... You already know that I killed Glouchar. And Daniel. And other missing stalkers.
I understand everything. Enough chitchat.
I do not understand...
Why do you do it?

I do not wish for anyone to experience what I have - haemoglobin dependence. I can't get up without it. Sometimes, it seems as if you can live without a single drop of blood for a month, which actually happened once, but then... comes the rage and you start to catch up..
How did you manage to hide it?

When I worked in surgery, it was easy to conceal. Blood was always in ample supply. But in the Zone... I thought that in such harsh conditions I would have no time for disease. But I was mistaken. The same rage came and I couldn't think of anything else. I decided to blame murders on bloodsucker attack... I usually chose the wounded as my prey...
And what about Daniel and Glouchar?

Daniel came to me for help after his attack on the bloodsuckers. He was injured ... When Glouchar agreed to go with him to the bloodsuckers, I realized that I did not have a lot of time. I managed to defend my secret, but not for long. Soon came Glouchar, who saw through my masquerade and tried to kill me... I feel sorry for them... but my regret will change nothing.
I understand everything. Enough chitchat.
I do not understand...
I'm listening to you.
Hello, need help?
Hello.
I need medical help.
Let's see ...
So, that's all... You can go.
Great! What, you are looking for artifacts too?
Hello... So, what's the word on the artifacts? There should be enough for all.
Oh, well! Do you also look for artifacts?
Great. Rushing with an artifact to Beard?
Maybe, maybe not... what's your point?
I need it.
Me too... But I can swap, let's say, for a new gun. An expensive one.
I have a good weapon. Let's swap.
Excellent.
That will not do.
Then fuck off and do not get in my way.
Okay.
In general, no.
What do you know about Nimble?

Nothing special... our businesses do not overlap - he might have a single mega-gun everyone's looking for, but by the time he sells it, I would have sold hundreds of regular ones already. Besides, he's legit, declining to do any deals with the local guys. To me, he's not trader and no rival.
Beard said that you agreed to different conditions.

What "different conditions"? The bearded goat just fears losing control! It's necessary to keep him in check, listen, the Creek has one really powerful man. His name is Sultan, go to him and he'll tell you what to do.
I'll go talk with Sultan.
No Sultans. I want my share now!
Ah... Okay. Take the money ... But remember, Beard leads you by the nose.
I need information.
What do you want to know?
I need poison gas. I hear you might know something.
Indeed I do. I'll tell you for 2000.
Here.

Listen. A military convoy was transporting a shipment of gas once, but they did not reach their destination. What happened between or to them is unknown, but the gas must still remain with the convoy. See where I'm going? There might even still be old documents there, if you find them, bring them to me, they'll cover the cost of the information.
Too rich for my blood.
As you wish.
Where can I find a stalker named Soroka?
I know something, it costs 1000.
Here.

You won't find him around here any more, but birds whispered to me that you should look around Jupiter, at Yanov for example. But remember, those who cause trouble in one place rarely keep their name when moving a new location... ask the stalkers there for clues.
I am looking for Snag. Do you know where I can find him?
I can tell you for 1000.
Here.

Snag is a greedy fool, he works with dangerous people... There is no going back for him, so it seems he must be somewhere near Jupiter. It has plenty of places to hide when you do not want to be found.
What do you know about the crashed helicopter?

Well, the place where they crashed - everyone knows where they are... One on the southern plateau, the second in the swamp lands, and the third - on the pillars of the substation. Which one do you want to know about?
About the southern plateau.
About the substation.
About the swamp.
helicopters until all.
Give me the money. 200.
Here.

So... so... the helicopter landed right on top of a Snork lair. According to my info, the soldiers got out - not everyone, of course, but most of them. They shot the mutants and made their getaway... by the way, if you want to go there, I can sell you a shotgun with ammunition, a good weapon against the creatures. But how to actually get to the plateau, only the thin Noah knows.
Too expensive for me.
As you wish.
I'll tell you for 200.
Here.
I'll tell you for 200.
Here.
Nothing for now.
Do you have any jobs?
First, there is the small business with the scientists, second, to get information from the mercenary camp, and, third, protection the trader needs. That's all that needs solving.
Tell me about the scientist business.

For starters, you need to get three Veles detectors and deliver to the scientist bunker, near the Jupiter factory. Talk to Novikov, he promised me to take a look at them. When the detectors turn a profit, we divide it in half, right down the middle. Clear enough?.
Alright.
Some other time.
Tell me about the mercenary camp.

Mercenaries showed up at the old waste processing plant, and I am very interested in what they are doing there. Get inside the camp and find information on their plans, anything. PDAs, documents, everything you can find, you bring it to me. All clear? Good. If done quietly, it's going to be a piece of cake.
Alright.
Not now.
Tell me about the merchant security gig.
A merchant need protection for a single transaction. You don't have to do nothing, just stand there and look tough, understand? The trader will be waiting near the forest, to discuss all the details.
Right.
Wait.
Next time.
There is this small business with academics - first, and second, to get information from the mercenary camp. Choose one you like more.
There is this small business with academics - first, and second, the trader still needs protection. Come on, make up your mind.
You need to get me information from the mercenaries' camp - that's the first job, and the second, the trader still needs protection. Come on, pick quickly.
A small business with the scientists. A simple Fed Ex job...
The trader still needs protection for a single transaction. Simple deal, really...
I don't have any more work for you.
I think you might be interested in ...
What have you got?
Noah's PDA.
That barge? I'll give you 1000 for it.
Alright.
I'll hold on to it.
Look, do not overdo it...
PDA of a merc named Hook. Found it at the sewage plant.
I'll give you 1000 for it.
Alright.
Very interesting ... Excellent job, stalker.
PDA of a mercenary named Ridge. Found it at the sewage plant.
I'll give you 1000.
Alright.
PDA with information about Monolith caches.
I'll give you 5000 for it.
Agreed.
PDA with data on mercenaries' clients.
I'll give you 4000.
Agreed.
PDA that belonged to Duty's founder, General Tachenko.
I'll give you a good price, 2500.
Agreed.
PDA of a mercenary.
That's 1000.
Agreed.
Morgan's PDA.
Dirt on a Dutyer selling guns left and right is always useful. I'll pay you 4000 for that PDA.
Agreed.
Note from Strelok's cache. Adressed to Ghost.
I'll give you 500.
Agreed.
Note from Strelok's cache. Adressed to Strelok.
I'll give you 500.
Agreed.
Note from Strelok's cache. Adressed to Fang.
I'll give you 500.
Agreed.
Documents from the Jupiter factory, a folder with an order of general evacuation.
I'll give you 750.
Agreed.
Documents from the Jupiter factory, a records notebook.
That's 750.
Sold.
Documents from the Jupiter factory, delivery schedules.
I'll give you 750.
Agreed.
Documents from the Jupiter factory, a letter about the decision to deliver Product No. 62 only through the underpass.
I'll give you 750.
Agreed.
Hardly. Once Sultan entered the field, I should stay away.
Let's see... Yes, it's interesting. Want to sell it?
Take it, I have no idea what it is.
Notebook from the mercenary camp in the treatment station.
I propose 2000 for it.
Agreed.
Heh, drag it to Beard or the scientists. I don't want to have anything to do with dubious goods - I don't like shivs in the night.
Now, listen here. In our line of work the risk is almost never worth it - I do not want to wake up in the night surrounded by anomalies. It's better if you take it to the scientists, for research.
And I have a nuke in my locker... go tell those jokes to the eggheads, maybe they will laugh.
Snag's PDA.
Let me look... hmmm, nothing special. You've probably picked his hiding spot clean by now, so it's just 200 for this.
agree.
PDA of one of Sultan's men.
Interesting ... Could be useful, I will give you 1000.
Agreed.
A memory module from an unmanned reconnaissance vehicle.
Interesting find... but it won't give much, I bet I'm not the first person who could copy information from it. My price is 500.
Sold.
Nothing.
About the detectors ...
What?
Where to find them?
I don't know - go around and look for them...
I have all the required detectors.
Then why are you still here? Bring them to Novikov, he's in the scientist bunker, near the Jupiter.
I gave detectors to Novikov.
Excellent. Let's wait until he's finished with them... Novikov promised that when they are done, he will send a reliable person with them to me.

There are problems. Our business deal is hanging in the air... Novikov completely overhauled the detectors, increased their range, sensitivity, database... With their help you can beat anyone to the artifacts. I arranged with Beard, so that stalkers he hires use the new detectors ...
And what's next?

According to the deal, we divide the loot in half... but stalkers refuse to bring us your cut. You have to go to Beard and convince him to fulfil his end of the bargain. Come on, you too want to get their share...
I need your new detector.
Ha ... And I need a cool gun. If you have a good, expensive weapon, we can swap.
It's a deal, let's swap.
Not really.
I need your new detector.
Is that a threat? I need it too, you know.
Do not you understand the situation? You are the last one left standing. The others won't be in any shape to mess around for a long time...
You what..? Crashed them? ...here you go, now leave me alone.
Listen, can you just go instead...?
Not yet. Please give me the detector, as a friend .
If you want me to be your friend... hit the road.
Stalker, want to earn some cash?
What do you need?

See, I hid my haul inside an old Zaporozhets. Suddenly, an earthquake came and the car went under. It looks pretty accessible, but, you know... Snorks roam down there. I'm not afraid of a controller, but a Snork... disgusts me horribly. If you can get the metal container with a combination lock out, then we can divide the loot.
Alright.
Thank you, stalker.
That.. is that my container?
Yes, indeed! Well, you skilled demon ...
Another time.
A pity...
No, I have a lot of tasks now.
Well, as you wish.
Well? What's new?
What do you want? Can't you see I'm busy ...
Hey, that's my gun! Where did you get it, you scoundrel? It was stolen from me the other day.
Are you crazy? I bought it recently.
I do not care where you got it or how, it's mine and it was stolen. So come on, do not make it hard, give me back the gun and let's remain friends.
Well, take it. I do not need unnecessary problems.
Come here...
I'm not giving you my gun.

You're not going to give it back, then?! I warn you: I have connections! I know everyone here! What, you think it's easy to live in the Zone with a bad rep, eh? What do you say to that? You are nobody, and no one will help you!
Yes, now leave me alone!
You sure this is your weapon?
Of course I'm sure. Have you seen a lot of these guns? It is mine.
You're mistaken. Now please, leave peacefully.

What? Then I was wrong! Do you think about what you say, asshole? If anything, everyone here will be on my side, give me the gun and quietly shamble off. About the gun, well, so be it, I won't tell anyone...
How about I just blow a hole in your head with this cannon?
Hey, man, do not get excited... we shouted at each other - that's enough... no need to be nervous. Maybe I was wrong.
About your container ...
Did you find it?
I'm still working on it.
I decided not to look for it.
A pity.
Well, let's see it.
Of course. Just a second ...
I decided to leave the container.
Oh ... I'll remember it!
Take the container.
Well, let's start to share the loot, okay?
Right.
What do we have here... My old lady, the Fort, the killer that's feared. Once my own uncle modified it with his own hands... A good memory... so this is mine.
No, better give it to me!
Oh, well, okay ...
Go on.
No, you already have a lot.
Go on.
Okay, what's else inside?
So... Look. An excellent medical kit. Good enough for a bear or even a controller. This is mine.
A medical set would be very handy!
Hmm... right.
Go on.
No, you already have a lot.
Go on.
Can I keep the rest for myself?

Well... Wow. You do not even know what a prize you're holding in your hands... a superior AKSU-74. I once traded a few medkits for it with a Dutyer. Then Freedom hit the Duty squad hard, depleting their stocks. This AKSU saved my life three times over... Undoubtedly, this is mine.
Maybe you'll give it to me?
Hmm... A pity. But a bargain is a bargain, take it.
Go on.
No, you already have a lot.
Go on.
Well, leave me, come on!
Oh... A valuable and beautiful thing... This artifact is worth tons of gold, I got it out of an anomaly personally! This is my trophy.
I think I could use it.
Oh, man... here, take it. You will remember my kindness for a long time.
Go on.
You already have a lot.
Go on.
Leave me, come on!

Well, the last item... a great helmet, handmade. Once a stalker appeared in the Cordon, a real mechanical genius. He made a few good items during his life and this helmet is one of them, you won't find another anywhere! I'll leave it for myself.
Still, I risked my life, struggled with Snorks... Give me the helmet.
Ah... so be it. Take it.
Go on.
You already have a lot. Let me keep at least some of my stuff!
Go on.
Okay, let me.
That's all, man, all the loot I had.
OK, fine.
That's all. But you can't leave empty handed... take my pistol!
Good luck.
What do you do?

I keep the order. I worked in the police as an investigator once and now I'm here, a kind of a local sheriff. I came here together with Beard, he was the one who decided to create a camp here. Why go further, he said, if the road to Pripyat is still unknown and the artifacts are plentiful. So, we stayed and here we are.
Who can I hire to protect the scientists?

I have a few candidates. For example, Spartacus' group. Great guys, true professionals in every sense of the word, many of them used to work for the Ministry of Internal Affairs. If they're not occupied by anything, they're the best protection you can get.
I would suggest something earlier, but now, I have no suitable people available. No local stalkers are adequate for the job.
Who can I hire to conduct measurements for scientists?
There's this group of hunters, Gaunt's their boss. Ask him, I think he'll agree... unless he's still busy shooting monsters.
If Gaunt and his team were around, I would have sent you to them... but alas, I know of no right people for the job.
Do you buy guns from Nimble? Could he be selling stolen weapons?
Do you think he would get away with such deals behind my back? ...No. This is not the case, I feel that he's a decent guy.
I am looking for Snag. Do you know where I can find him?
I know Snag. He's a fool, the boys saw him at the port cranes recently. Something's definitely going on there, you should check it out.
Hello stalker. Would you like to earn cash, and at the same time help the camp?
Hello stalker. Are you still available? The bloodsuckers will surely overwhelm us at this rate.
Let's talk later. I need to check something...
What work can you offer?

There's one thing... a few stalkers disappeared. We didn't hear from them ever again, but one was found recently. There were no signs of foul play on the body, but it was completely dry, drained of blood. Tremor checked the corpse, he can give you a better description. But basically, it's obvious - damn bloodsuckers are behind it! I spoke to a hunter named Daniel, who went off to find their lair. I had no word from him ever since.
What do you want me to do?
We must find the lair, and if possible, Daniel. It's a dangerous job, but the pay is great. Well, do you want it?
I do.

Good. Okay, I have two sites that need to be verified. I sent the coordinates to the first one to your PDA. I'll just tie up a few loose ends here and then I'll check the other location. I'll contact you as soon as I find something.
Agreed.
Not really.
When you change your mind, come back.
Not interesting.
The same... as long as there is a bloodsucker nest around here, we are all in danger. As for Daniel, no dice. Can you help me out?
Glouchar said that you examined the body of one of the missing stalkers. Do you think that the stalker was killed by a bloodsucker?

I did an exam... It was like all the other dead bodies... No other creature is capable of sucking all blood out from a human to the last drop. The body had signs of bloodsucking... What else can it be?
Tell me about yourself.

I am a physician, a surgeon to be more precise. What else do you want to know? If the need be, I can remove a hypothalamus from a brain with jeweller's precision, but no one in the Zone needed that yet... So, I'm an ordinary doctor, who actually knows his trade.
I'm listening to you.
Can you decrypt the black box?

Well... I don't really understand electronics, all these schematics, algorithms... not my speciality. Now, if it based on simple laws of physics, I can fix it easily. Like, look, shake and get everything where it should be.
What do you think, could Nimble be selling stolen goods?

Oh, that's rubbish... Nimble suddenly "stealing"? I don't believe that. Do you know who helped me set up this workshop when I moved in? Nimble. And he did it out of pure decency. So, to my knowledge, Nimble's a good guy.
Do you have a job for me?

Oh please. I need tools, but I have no time to look for them. Technology is the kind of thing that needs my constant attention. So, if you can bring me a functional piece of scrap, I can show you what "upgrade" really means... And you could gain a penny or two.
Okay. I'll see what I can do.
No. I'll see you later..
Oh yes. I need tools, remember? I need aid, you need money, easy.
Can you unlock the memory module?
No... I can't help you there. All those modern electronics, computers... Not for me. Better look for someone younger, they grow into this hogwash from the cradle.
You can open a steel container?
Ah, easily. 500 and everything inside will be in the best shape.
Here.
Taa, come here, affix... hook up, press gently... and rrrrra! ...done. Haven't seen a thing I couldn't open with a crowbar and a hammer.
Lots of it here.
Come if you need me, I'm always here!
I will think about it.
Here's some vodka. Want it?

I dropped the habit, no more drinking. When I saw Product No. 62, I thought that I had enough. Too many problems because of the booze. And the health... besides, who will rig Gauss cannon batteries for you, eh?
Here, take another bottle.
And here's the third bottle... If you need more.
I brought you the tools.
Not bad... what type I wonder?
For rough work.
Normalek! Now, I only need tools for fine work and calibration...
Normalek! Now, I only need tools for fine work, sniper rifles and calibration...
For fine work.
Normalek! Now, I only need tools for rough work and calibration...
Normalek! Now, I only need tools for sniper rifles, rough work and calibration...
For calibration.
Normalek! Now, I only need tools for rough and fine work...
Normalek! Now, I only need tools for sniper calibration and for rough and fine work...
Not right now.
For sniper rifle calibration.
Excellent! Now I just need calibrating instruments, and the problems will disappear...
Excellent! Now I just need calibrating instruments and tools for the sniper rifles, and the problems will disappear...
Excellent! Now I just need tools for fine work, and the problems will disappear...
Excellent! Now I just need tools for fine work and sniper calibration, and the problems will disappear...
Excellent! Now I just need tools for rough work, and the problems will disappear...
Excellent! Now I just need tools for rough work and sniper calibration, and the problems will disappear...
Ah, classy! You delivered! How did you manage to find them all? Now I have a full set. Ha! I can collect that light machine gun now!
Fantastic! Now all I need is the tools for sniper rifle calibration.
Good, now I only need tools for calibration, rough and fine work...
I brought the schematics and documentation on Product No. 62.

You found something! ... Normalek! I knew that the bastards did not have time to destroy everything ... Let me see ... M-hm ... Here, then, that's how they solved it ... Excellent! I need a couple of hours to understand the papers fully. And I can try patching the Gauss cannon, if you leave it. Can you wait? ... Soon, you will sing, my dear!
I need batteries for the Gauss cannon.
For you, a cheap price. For 2000.
Here's the money.
I will think about in.
No money for now.
Did you repair the Gauss cannon?
Ah, that was easy. The power system is clear and understandable... If you get any problems with the gun, just come back to me.
More work... oh, it's nice to tamper with works of their hands...
I have an unknown weapon system.
How can it be "unknown"?... Come, show me what you've got there ...
Look ... Have you ever seen this before?
Ah.. You? ... Oh, well, sit ... Imagine, I dreamt that you brought something from my past... I think I was drinking again...
Did you dream of a weapon, perchance?

Oh, f- ... So, I did not imagine it ... This is a Gauss Cannon, or, in other words, as it was called officially, "Product number 62" ... Phew ... I once worked on this project in the Jupiter factory. I was in weapons development, focusing - as I remember - on those "based on the principle of accelerating projectiles in an electromagnetic field". Just look, those coils are my handiwork... unfortunately, the project was shut down in 2004, as we couldn't create an energy source that was compact enough...
This weapon was used recently, what could change in the past years?

Hell if I know... I don't want to dig in that battery with my screwdriver. Then there's the damage to the power supply... it wouldn't hurt to have a look at the schematics. I worked in the testing facility, where we had all the documentation. I think all the schematics and other documents for the Gauss cannon might still be there... I'm sure of it. Hey, I even kept a key-card from the facility...
Can you give me the key card?
What's really there... wait. Don't damage it, if possible. Now, if you bring me the documentation, I might be able to fix the damage.
Here's your access card. I return safe and sound.
Thank you. It's important to me, as a memory.
Well, what? ... It's you ... don't be shy, bring that torn armour, broken guns... I don't promise anything when sober, but I can take a look...
Where did you go? ... I've been waiting for you ... And looked here and there - no ... Where, I thought, did that stalker go ... Well, what do you need?
Cheers ... Well, good that you brought it to me ... is that something to fix or to drink, to those no longer with us? ...
Uh ... Normalek! ... Hands, like, do not tremble any more, but the head still needs more ... Maybe, between the first and second ... ?
Why so slow? Get another one! ... Common cause, let's have a drink, okay? We must. How to go blonde for the body, these marvels of technology going on around ...
Ah, if only Joker would be here ... let's drink to Barge ... Well ... Let him rest in peace ... He was a good man, indomitable. Strong as a rock ...
Oh, if only Barge would be here ... let's drink to Joker ... Well ... Let him rest in peace ... He was a good man, always able to support. And the word, and deed ...
Ah ... Barge ... Joker ... How did it all happen ... And so, little by little......
Mm-wat? ... What are we doing here? ... Armoured automatics will come tomorrow ... Al-t happens, do not worry ... There chekuha are breaking, dining ...
Ah, Sixty-Two... Let's look at the concept ...
Ah, you chose correctly ... I can patch a gun easily.. and if you brought a bottle or two, then I'll make you any modification you want. Although a parachute on a shotgun will look silly...

Do you have any idea how ingenious this is? The battery is powered by electrostatic artifacts! Ha! ... I knew that that it wasn't normal tech! ... The principle is elementary, I can rig similar batteries myself...
Need something upgraded or repaired?
We'll see, we'll see... I'm not really used to this style of documentation....

I came to the Creek with two buddies of mine, Barge and Joker. They were young, eager! Anxious to grab the artifact piles, almost climbing over each other to the get to the anomalies. I see their eager, burning eyes and I realize, that rushing is not the best idea. In search of unknown loot, we could end up in the middle of a mutant lair... an unpleasant end.
And what happened next?

See... we sat down once, in the evening, we drank together... they began to argue about what should we do next - go, stay or if go, then where... everyone was pushing his idea and not giving up a single inch. In the end, they quarrelled and went their separate ways... Me too, of course. They said they haven't seen everything yet... and everyone... Eh. Now, if I met them, I'd apologize for what was said... maybe we could sit together, like before, and have a drink...
I can convey your apology to Barge, if I meet him.
That would be nice ...
I can convey your apology to your comrades, if I meet them.
That would be nice ...
I can convey your apology to Joker, if I meet him.
That would be nice ...
I found a PDA - take a look.
Why would I want a PDA? ... What's with this PDA ?...
Barge is dead?!... It cannot be ... How? ... He was as hard as a rock ... Ah ... Barge ... Rest in peace ... Hopefully, Joker's all right ...
Barge is dead?!... It cannot be ... How? ... He was as hard as a rock ... Ah ... Barge... Joker ... Rest in pieces, my friends ... How did it happen ...
They are dead ?!... It cannot be ... How? ... Barge was as strong as a rock ... And the Joker ... Ah ... Joker ... No last laugh for you ... At peace with the world ... How did it happen ...
Could you answer a couple of questions?
Of course.
How long do I have to wait for my order?
It all depends on the complexity of the order. Usually, it takes about a day, sometimes less.
Tell me about yourself.

Nothing out of the ordinary. Most of what happened to everyone, happened to me. Anomaly diving, capture by bandits... I came to the Zone as a young kid. At first, I was a supplies courier, for small stuff like antirads, AP rounds... Then, I hooked up with Sidorovich, after he saved my life. While working for him, I found a few useful acquaintances and when the opportunity came to do special orders, I took it. I decided to opt out of crazy business, since I felt that my number was coming up. I didn't fancy dying for a bottle of vodka any more.
Thanks, I understand everything.
I was happy to help.
I was told you sell stolen guns.

Wait, what? I do not sell stolen goods. I only do direct transactions, if you don't believe me, then talk to the people here, they will confirm that I am an honest trader, who doesn't screw anyone over.
I came across a stalker who said that this is his gun.
His name?
Snag.
What's the difference?
There is a difference. Someone wanted to fool you, stalker.
We'll see.
Someone wanted to fool you, stalker.
I want to pick up an order.

Here it is, the Steppe Eagle. Had bit of trouble with that one... one collector was interested in this pistol, I snatched it from under his nose. Just look - all hand made, parts fitted with jeweller's precision... ever heard of the quip "sniper pistol"? This is it. I'll let it go for 2800.
Here's the cash.
And here's your purchase. Thank you for ordering.
I do not have enough money.
Well, I can hold on to it for a bit... I hope you can find the necessary amount.
I do not want to buy it.
If you refuse to take the order, I will have to assume that I can't rely on you as a customer. The price will need to be adjusted for the risk and the deposit amount will increase too.
Nevertheless, I will not pick up this order.
Well, it's your business.
I will think about it.
If you want to, of course... I'll hold on to your goods for you.
Here, sniper-pistol Steppe Eagle. Do you have 2800?

Now, look at this, this is the Alpine. I can safely say that this is a one-of-a-kind pistol, at least in the Zone. It's unique, made in small amounts for a special order. It wasn't easy to get, but I pulled some strings abroad and... well, here you have it, increased magazine capacity with the feed from enriched steel and receiver made from an ultra-strong polymer. Give me the remaining 2800, and it is yours.
OK, a pistol with an increased magazine, the Alpine. Just pay the remaining 2800 and it's yours.

Now, look. This is March, which belonged to a mercenary named Wolfhound. Compact, high calibre pistol with a short shutter speed and a lightweight bolt. The bastard knew how to pick good, rare weapons... they say his favourite exercise was shooting his victim into all five extremities before he hit the ground... it can be yours for 2800.
So, rapid-firing pistol, March. Do you have 2800?

OK, don't give me that look. This is Frazier, and it is a completely new weapon. See? No serial number, it's straight from the weapon labs. It was designed as a next generation close combat weapon, with a high calibre, high rate of fire and high accuracy. Do you have 8000?
Yeah, here's the rapid-firing sub machine gun, Frazier. The price is 8000.

Now this is a fine gun - the Carabinieri. It's a military shotgun, with fully automatic fire and great accuracy, with a well-compensated recoil and a balanced universal system. It can be yours for the remaining 8000.
Here, an automatic shotgun, Carabinieri. Just 8000.

I think this is exactly what you'll need. A Protecta, one of the newest weapons on the market. The entire stock was headed to Central Africa, but a single test gun was flown to me, since I am friends with the distributor. So, an automatic shotgun with a large magazine and excellent rate of fire. Pay 8000 and it's yours.
Of course. Protecta automatic shotgun, with a larger magazine. Just 8000.

Alright. Here's the Thunderstorm grenade launcher/rifle system. A prototype! The base rifle was modified with Zone operations in mind. It's a miracle of engineering done by our fellow Slavs... 16000 and you can take it away.
Of course. Here, the Thunderstorm rifle/grenade launcher system, with a larger magazine, just pay the remaining 16000.

Here it is, the G36 next generation assault rifle. Accurate, reliable, comfortable and with integrated optics. It used to belong to a group of UN observers, sent to the Zone to assess the situation. The situation got critical and, well, now the rifle can be yours for just 16000.
Here it is, the G36 next generation assault rifle. Yours for 16000.

One moment... here, an FN 2000 modular rifle, the brainchild of Belgian arms manufacturers. Accurate, versatile, ambidextrous, integrated optics and with a grenade launcher to boot! Got it from an UN observer... the price is 16000.
Here, an FN 2000 modular rifle. The price is 16000.

Here, the Surf. Created for military units on the basis of a silent sniper rifle, specifically to take down zombies. While the rate of fire was reduced, its firepower was significantly increased, enough to take down a zombie with a single shot, not compromising your position. Once it became obvious that zombies did not go outside the Zone borders, the rifle was cancelled, never reaching full production. Yours for the remaining 16000.
Here, the Surf noiseless sniper rifle with increased firepower. You can take it for 16000.

Here. This is the SVU-A, a shortened sniper rifle with an increased rate of fire. I bought it from Max, the legendary guardian of Freedom. He swore that it's a one of a kind weapon in the entire Zone, or at least these parts. The price is 16000.
Yep. SVU-A - shortened sniper rifle with an increased rate of fire. The price is 16000.

Of course. Now look, this is the Lynx, put together by one local expert. He's dead now, so it's one of a kind. Might not look any different from a regular rifle, but you'll feel the difference immediately, that ideal balance of accuracy and firepower. Just 16000 and it's yours.
Yes, Lynx, a sniper rifle with high accuracy and power. Just pay the remaining 16000.

Now look what I managed to get - a CHN-3a armour with a tactical helmet. The latter might not be unique, but it's a good base for a complete mobile tactical system, including high-quality night vision goggles and an active infra-red scanner. Now, the CHN-3a is a different case. Good protection from bullets and anomalies is combined with light weight and great mobility, a very rare combination. I can let it go for 32000.
Yeah. A set of CHN-3a armour and a tactical helmet. All together - 32000.

Got this specially for you - a SEVA suit. Like you wanted, a closed-circuit respirator, plus thermal and electric shielding as well as a special anti-corrosion coating. Built in artifact containers are just the cherry on top. An indispensable thing for any stalker. 24000, as agreed.
Here. SEVA suit. 24000, as agreed.

Here he is, the beautiful battle exoskeleton, single unit. The best protection from bullets, shrapnel and claws, one can find in the Zone, except for armoured vehicles. In fact, like those armoured vehicles, the suit reduces your encumbrance, within reason, of course. For 48000 - take it with all the armour, batteries and servos.
Here it is - a battle exoskeleton battle, single unit... just 48000 and take it away.
I want to place an order.
No problem. What should I get?
A pistol.
Easy. The pistol will cost 3500. I need 700 as a down payment.
Well, here's the cash.
I will contact you when the order is ready.
I have no money.
Well... bring the money - I'll get the stuff.
You know, I changed my mind.
Okay. If you still decide to order something - just talk to me.
You are not a very reliable buyer. As such, the gun costs 4200. I need 1400 as a down payment.
I'm afraid the best guns are already sold out. You can buy regular stuff from Owl.
A weapon for close combat.
You're not joking I see... It will cost you 10000, and I need 2000 right away.
You refused to take the previous order... So, this will cost you 12000, and 4000 I need right now.
Hmmm ... You know, I can't help. The demand's too big.
An assault weapon.
With heavy firepower and fire rate... Calling price is 20000, 4000 of which I need as a deposit. What do you think?
It is difficult to work with you. The price is now 24000, with 8000 as down payment. Deal?
See, I have a problem. The soldiers in the Cordon are pissed, someone attacked their checkpoint recently, so it's hard to make any kind of deal with them.
A sniper rifle.
I can get one for 20000, but you need to pay 4000 in advance.
I have to account for the risks included in working for you. I can try organizing a weapon for 24000, but I need 8000 in advance.
Sorry, I'm in a tight spot. My sniper rifle supplier has... health problems.
Body armour.
I've got something in mind ... Costs 40000, but 8000 needs to be paid in advance.
I've got something in mind ... You did not take the last order, so this order costs 48000 and I need 16000 right now.
I've got nothing better than the previous set, sorry... and yes, that was the only one I could get.
Suit with a closed-circuit breathing system.
A rare order... I don't know, I can try to get one for 30000, but I need 6000 as a deposit.
You let me down on the previous order, so I'm not sure I should take this one... I can try to get one for 36000, but I need 12000 as a deposit.
I had great difficulties finding that first suit, and this time around, I'm afraid I won't find another.
An exoskeleton.
A serious choice. I think I can get a battle version, but it will cost 60000. Not cheap, but it's well worth the money. Just remember, I need 12000 right now.
You weren't very ethical about your previous order, so this one will cost you 72000. With 24000 right now.
No chance. Ever since I got the first one, the manufacturing plant closed down and now most exoskeletons come from corpses... and that's not my style.
Nothing right now.
Sorry, I can't do that. I have temporary difficulties with other orders...

Welcome, I'm Nimble... I'm the guy to look for if you need a unique weapon. Rare models, prototypes, clean guns... oh, and elite suits, latest and greatest in defensive and military technologies. I check every item personally, so satisfaction is guaranteed.
Welcome. Do you want to order something?
Welcome.
Your order will be done shortly.
Your order is complete, you can pick it up now.
Hey! Are you Snag's pal?
Yes, I know him.
He said that you're the one bringing the loot.
That wasn't our agreement.
So that's how it is... and here we are, waiting like bums...
Later.
This ain't going to work!
Think again. If you're not a complete retard, you'll realize that you should agree with the majority...
I said - stay away!
No. I do not know.
Aaaa ... hell .... got suckered in ... Help me, my friend, need a first aid kit... I don't have much time...
Here, take a first aid kit.
Uh ... Thank you, buddy ... the Boiler's hardly pleasant, I'd be dog food.... take my detector as a thank you, it'll come in handy. I'll take some time off at base, I think.
Good luck.
Uh ... Thank you, buddy ... the Boiler's hardly pleasant, I'd be dog food.... Take this artifact, it's useful. Treat this as my thanks... I'll take some time off at base, I think.
I can't, I need it more than you do.
I have no first-aid kits.
Once again, thank you! Without your help I would not be here...

Stalker! Hurry, help Petrukha! Can you see him, at the edge of the fault? The anomaly hit him, with tremendous force! And I, you see, I just can't! We'll pool our savings with Petrukha to repay you, just go there and help him! Help!
Well, calm down. I'll try.
Go away.
Thank you for saving Petrukha... He'd have surely bit the dust if it wasn't for you...
Get out of here... Because of you Petrukha died... He was my friend...
Later.
I destroyed the bloodsucker lair.
Nice, you avenged the missing, peace be upon them... you truly deserve this reward.
We discovered a whole nest of bloodsuckers under the BIS.

Hmmm... the nest needs to be destroyed. God knows how many beasts are there in the tunnels. We need to gas them all, I recall Owl mentioning something about a gas canister or something. Go talk to him, I'm not on the best terms... if you can get it, plug it into the bunker's ventilation system and they should all die in just minutes.
I'll do it.
I'll think about it.
I already have that gas canister.
Wow... You really do have skill. It'll come in handy.
Ah, here's a stalker. Waiting for you.
What are we doing?
SCHA are going to boom. Personally you do, I hope, nothing will. Just stand by and do not ride the waves.
agreed.
Ha. Broken at times ... And you normally pull the trigger you squash, stalker. Hold.
luck.
You - Fraer cheapest. Tore us a trifling matter. Get out.
While.
Che be?
anything.
You from Owl?
Yes. He said you need help.
That is true. I have a bad feeling about this.
Alright. What should I do?
Provide me with security for a single transaction. Nothing more.
Doesn't seem too difficult.
OK, stay close and cover me.
Understood.
I will only talk with the head.
As you wish.
Thank you, stalker, you were of great help. I knew these monsters would cook up something, they must've been stalking us for quite a bit. Here's your reward.
Good luck.
You're a lazy bum, not liking to actually work... but I'll pay you, as promised.
Good luck.
You're a lazy bum, not liking to actually work... but I'll pay you, as promised.
Good luck.
What do you want? Thank you for nothing, I barely survived... get out of my sight.
Good luck.
Alright, let's go. We'll quietly sneak up on the bandits, hear what they're talking about. Then, we'll see.
I understand.
Thanks stalker, here, take this for your help. The main reward is waiting for you at the bar.
I understand.
Tell me about your life.
Big subject... be more specific.
What are you doing here?

I look after stalkers. Just look around, half of you are pure children, jumping into the zone with heads full of dreams, or heroic fantasies or just plain turning your back on life. And what do most meet? Just that skinny man with a scythe. We're here to catch those. Usually, we snatch them in the Garbage, taking their stuff and sending them back to the Cordon. If they're reasonable, they'll see the point and go back to the outside world. And if they come back again - we'll organize a funeral for him, out of pure niceness. Let me just say, that where we are, there are no soldiers, mercs or even mutants, none stick around.
What led you to the centre of the Zone?

My legs. We went after stalkers, what else? People need order and primitives need to be controlled. As it was, everyone just grabbed anything they could fine. And, pray tell, who will pay us then, for peace, for security provided... see, sometimes, your brother is digging through an anomaly when a mutant comes. If we're around, we'll help and take just a small cut from his haul...
How did you become a VIP?

Want my story? Let's see, where to begin... I guess school's a good place. I had a good friend back then, Tolyan. We did stuff together, breaking into old buildings, drinking, smoking... except, it wasn't enough for him, he started doing drugs. Mushrooms were first, then came ganja and, with the pushers, cocaine. I told him "Tolyan, drop that habit", but he didn't listen to me. The dope dealers gave him some kind of poison and he kicked the bucket. I found the bastards and carved them up nicely. I got arrested shortly afterwards and put to work in the Zone, as a wrecking crew worker. I managed to slip away and went deeper into the Zone, where they would not find me. I found a group of people I fit in with nicely, so I stayed here... it took me a good six months. Eventually, I ended up in this position, keeping my boys in check and giving young stalkers advice...
What do you think about stalkers?

I'm not going to tell you everything, but know this - most are clueless vagrants, with no spines or talent, acting as if the Zone was no different from the outside world. Some of those we milk, some we get rid off, but most we just chase off. It's a pity that not every one is bright enough to get the clue...
Ah, okay. Forget it.
Okay.
Now Beard will work for us.
As they say, "Our cow, let's milk him"... I'll keep an eye on him, just don't forget to pick up your cut regularly.
Beard got an important order, for an artifact called the Compass.
We need that artifact, Beard would not take such an order if he couldn't complete it. It's the key to his business. If you find this Compass, bring it to me.
I found the Compass. Here.
I refuse to look for the Compass for you.
Listen, little man, and remember. I do not like those who take a job and fail to complete it. And those I don't like don't live long. Got it?
Uh...
I took the detectors from the stalkers.
Nice. I'll get them examined by my client via other channels.

I heard rumours that you're the one who gave Beard the Compass... Now, listen, little man, and remember. I do not like those who take a job and fail to complete it. And those I don't like don't live long. Got it?
Beard has no more advanced detectors.
Song to my ears. As far as I know, all of his trade channels pretty much dried up, and we took over his customers. Now, go to Beard and give him Sultan's regards.
Beard owes me money. Owl said that you can help.
Maybe... here's the deal: tear down Beard's business, let me take it over, you'll get a cut and loot. Sounds fine?
Yeah.
Your task - go find out what's Beard up to right now. Cut his supply lines and get me some accurate info.
I'll think about it.
Just remember, too much thinking is hazardous.
What do you think, can Nimble be selling stolen goods?
Nimble? He's a coward, this is Owl's job... then again, so is anything, since he doesn't ask questions.
I am looking for Snag. Do you know where I can find him?
I know. He has been seen recently at the port cranes. We should've squeezed the bitch for our money, but we didn't have the time to do it.
I have a job for you. My boys are meeting this one guy... the Zone's dangerous as of late, so one more gun can't hurt. You're to make sure nothing bad happens.
Alright.
Good. My people will meet you near the forest. I sent you the coordinates.
I understand.
Not interested.
What are you doing here? Go to the Forestry.
Yes.
Made up your mind? You with us or what?
With you.
Alone.
Remember. I am Sultan. Everything that goes on here is under my control, or will be soon. If you want to be rich, work for me. If you don't - you'll live in poverty. That's all.
What do you want?
What do you need?
Well?
I've killed all the stalkers myself.
Well, you are... one tough kid, damn you. Keep in touch, there are problems arising that need fixing... you can be our... solution, damn you.
How's the scientist gig going?
Not bad, we had no major problems yet, everything's quite quiet. Scientists threw some gear our way, so it's all quite OK.
Excellent! The job's not hard and pays well. Plus, ever since we got here, the scientists mentioned that they haven't seen a single mutant.
I'm putting together a squad for a hike in Pripyat. Want to go with me?

Oh, no... Unlike others, I'm don't really want to see Pripyat. Besides, the scientists need protection, as per our agreement. You should try with the soldier, he's a good choice, he'd look for his guys there and we'd get a break. He's a decent guy, but he really has no place here.
Oh, no... Unlike others, I'm don't really want to see Pripyat. Besides, the scientists need protection, as per our agreement.
Want to work for the scientists?
What would we be doing?
Guarding their bunker.
Well... security's not a new job for us... Alright. We'll pack up and move to the bunker.
You'll be checking anomalies out.
I'm as much a researcher as a tushkano is a guinea pig. We would be of little help.
Let's talk about this later, we have problems of our own here. Let's find an answer to them first, then we can talk about finding us a new job.
Hey, let's go. We should hit them quickly.
Good.
It would be better to wait in shelter... emissions are terrible.
OK. Stick together, will hit them quickly... watch the heights.
Cool, we got them all! Here, have some cash. Now, if more of them appear, we'll take care of them.
Well, you are ... tough kid, your mother. Sam came, all filled up ... At the horseradish, I got in touch with you. Bablo not broke, problems Narula ... You are ... accurate, your mother ...

not understand ?!... Where stalkers fucking ?!... This Th? It's you, bitch, passed? Nobody else! All bro was next to me ... SCHA we'll instead stalkers ashmonaem! Well, Th, your mother, you look - come on, that is!
Let's have it ... to the barge.
And, uncle, great. You are ... Pardon moi, somehow I was not in the vein of talk.
I'll help you.

Excellent. As agreed, we'll prepare a welcoming committee, while you go to this asshole. When they come, we hit them from all sides, just remember to stay away from them, or my boys might shoot you up by mistake.
Agreed.
No. I can't agree to that.
Cheers, stalker. I'm still busy ... Let's chat later, shall we?
Thanks for the warning... maybe you can help us, attack them from the rear?
We will ambush them, and then you'll hit them from the rear.
Bastards ... Thanks for the warning.
Thank you for your help.
Cool... Listen, if it's anything important - then we'll chat, OK?
Welcome.
I found Soroka. He was at Yanov, calling himself Flint. He's been taken care of.
Taken care of? Heh, so I won't get a chance to grab his throat... Ah well, it's still good news. Here, take this, as promised.
Thanks.
I want to leave the Zone.
Are you sure? This is a one way trip.
I'm sure, let's go.
Oh... I'll stay, then.
Alright, take the cash. Just stop yelling.
What? Gimme all yer cash, fucker! Now! Quickly!
I'm leaving.
This will not work!
let's see... with your health, I'd be reserving a spot at the morgue soon...
Listen, there is an urgent matter. Our trader wants to do a transaction, but the clients want protection, just in case. You interested?
Yes.
Good. The merchant will wait near the forest, he'll discuss all the details.
Not really.
Well, look. There is still a bit of time, so if you change your mind, just talk to me.
What jobs can you offer?
Profitable ones. Listen, you're a new guy, with no friends... with me, you can get to the top quick... want to hear what I have to say?
I'm interested.

Then look here. There is a group of stalkers Beard hired to transport cash. Currently, they are in one spot... will you go with some of my boys to Shevchenko, pose as customers and take them out?
